name: United Kingdom
notes: When calling the UK from abroad, drop the leading 0 (trunk prefix).
UK numbers are often written with (0) in the area code to show the trunk prefix is optional internationally.

name: United States
notes: The US uses the North American Numbering Plan (NANP) country code +1.
Domestic dialing rules vary by area; internationally you generally dial +1 followed by the 10-digit number.

name: Canada
notes: Canada shares country code +1 (NANP) with the US and others.
International format is +1 followed by the 10-digit number.

name: France
notes: When calling France from abroad, drop the leading 0.

name: Germany
notes: When calling Germany from abroad, drop the leading 0.

name: Spain
notes: Spain does not use a separate trunk prefix 0 for geographic numbers in the same way as some other European countries.
International format is +34 followed by the national number.

name: Italy
notes: Italy is special: the leading 0 of many fixed-line numbers is often dialed even from abroad.
Italy has nuanced fixed/mobile rules. We keep normalization simple for now and show warnings when a leading 0 is present.

name: Ireland
notes: When calling Ireland from abroad, drop the leading 0.

name: Australia
notes: When calling Australia from abroad, drop the leading 0.

name: India
notes: When calling India from abroad, drop the leading 0 if present.
